body.p: James Madison University (JMU) is a public university located in Harrisonburg, Virginia, known for its student-centered learning environment.

section.title: Student Population
section.p: JMU has about 22,000 students, predominantly undergraduates, with a strong focus on liberal arts and sciences.

section.title: Popular Majors and Degrees
section.p: Popular majors include Health Sciences, Business, and Education. JMU is also known for its Music and Performing Arts programs.

section.title: Location
section.p: Located in Harrisonburg, Virginia, the campus is nestled in the scenic Shenandoah Valley.

section.title: Mascot
section.p: The mascot is "Duke Dog," symbolizing the James Madison Dukes.

section.title: Additional Information
section.p: JMU is known for its close-knit community, high graduation rates, and emphasis on experiential learning.
